On 4/23/13 6:57 PM, Jian wrote:
> I was crawling using Heritrix 1.14.4 using 5000 seed URLs. I used the
> default deciding rules in all parts except the writer. I used the
> mirrorwriter and only download application/pdf files to our archive.
>
> The crawling progresses fast between 0-90% but after that the crawl
> becomes very slow. Particularly, the number of active threads is very
> low. Out of the 50 threads, only 1-5 are active. How does this
> happen? Why are there so many idle threads?

Usually this is because all the fast/easy sites have been completed -- 
leaving only a handful of sites to collect, which happen to be 
largest/slowest (or completely unresponxive).

As a matter of polite/responsible crawling, Hertirix only makes one 
request to a site at a time, waits a little longer between requests when 
a site's responses are slow, and waits a lot longer (15 minutes) between 
retries when a site isn't responding at all. (That's to give time for 
possibly-temporary remote network/server issues to resolve, without 
using up all the limited-count of retries.)

More discussion at:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/unexpectedly+slow+crawling+on+idle+crawler

Oftentimes the URLs left to crawl (the last X%) are all non-responsive, 
and so rather than waiting for all the slow-retries to finish all their 
failed attempts, a crawl operator will just decide to manually terminate 
the crawl.
